intro: Pentacalia cachacoensis, commonly known as the Cachacoense pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Its leaves are usually lanceolate and arranged alternately along the stem. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
